title: Welsh elections 2021: Will 16 and 17-year-olds vote?
description: The age of voting has reduced in Wales to 16 but how many of this age group will cast their ballot?

title: Bafta Games Awards 2021: Hades takes Best Game
description: The Ancient Greek action adventure won big on the night with five awards in total.

title: Postman plagued by 'Mr Angry' pheasant on round in Brooke
description: The pheasant pecks Kevin Keeler's ankles and knocks letters out of his hands.

title: The Dig: Lego version of Sutton Hoo treasure 'amazing'
description: A father and daughter are told their Lego tribute is good enough to be put on display.

title: Digital images made of Leith medieval graveyard skulls
description: The remains of the man and the woman were uncovered as part of work to build new tramway in Edinburgh.

title: Simon McCoy to leave BBC News after 17 years
description: The TV news presenter, known for his funny asides, is to join Andrew Neil's new GB News operation.

title: Facial recognition beats the Covid-mask challenge
description: As people all over the world mask up, how has the facial-recognition industry coped?

title: Covid-19: Merkel defends rollout as vaccine pressure grows
description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel defends the EU's decision to procure coronavirus vaccines jointly.

title: Cornwall plane crash: Two pilots eject from Royal Navy jet
description: Two pilots are taken to hospital after ejecting from the Hawk T1 jet near RNAS Culdrose.

title: Covid: Jab passports possible 'only after all vaccinated'
description: A review on certificates showing jab status is due in April but no decisions have been made, says PM.

title: MPs to vote on extending emergency Covid-19 powers to autumn
description: MPs are being asked to extend unprecedented emergency laws brought in a year ago to deal with the virus.

title: Suez Canal: Owner of cargo ship blocking waterway apologises
description: Japanese firm Shoei Kisen Kaisha says dislodging the Ever Given is proving "extremely difficult".

title: Johnny Depp refused permission to appeal libel verdict
description: A judge rules the US actor's appeal against a High Court ruling has "no real prospect of success".

title: Fifa to take no action over Norway players' Qatar human rights protest
description: Norway players wear T-shirts bearing the message 'Human rights on and off the pitch' before their 2022 World Cup qualifier against Gibraltar to show support for Qatar migrant workers.

title: Covid vaccine: AstraZeneca updates US vaccine efficacy results
description: The vaccine-maker slightly amends its efficacy rates as it awaits US regulatory approval.

title: Winston Churchill, Kermit and Janet Jackson recordings preserved for posterity
description: Their recordings are being added to the US National Recording Registry by the Library of Congress.

title: Nationwide tells 13,000 staff to 'work anywhere'
description: The UK's biggest building society says it wants to give employees more control over their lives.

title: Santander to close more than 100 branches
description: The bank says 840 staff will be affected by the decision although it will try to offer them roles elsewhere.

title: Former England fly-half Cipriani agrees contract with Bath
description: Former England fly-half Danny Cipriani agrees a deal to join Bath on an "extended one-year contract" that begins in May.

title: Covid-19: Over-50s urged to book jabs before vaccine supplies dip
description: The NHS highlights the deadline of 29 March ahead of an expected slowdown in vaccine supplies in April.

title: 'This little flame never lost hope' - Olympic torch relay finally begins
description: A year later than planned, an Olympic torch relay with a difference begins in Japan as the build-up for the Tokyo Games gets under way.

title: Holyrood election 2021: The intense battle for every vote in Scotland
description: Polling expert Professor John Curtice looks at the issues that will decide the Scottish Parliament election on 6 May.

title: 'If you want to default me, I will gladly sue' - Pospisil sorry for furious rant in Miami
description: Vasek Pospisil apologises for an expletive-filled rant in a match at the Miami Open, during which he threatened to sue tennis organisers.

title: Catalytic converter thefts: Surge in cases reported to Met Police
description: More than 300 officers took part in raids across east London, Kent and Essex, with three men arrested.

title: New Alan Turing £50 note design is revealed
description: The banknote will enter circulation on 23 June - Alan Turing's birthday - and will be made of polymer.

title: Covid: Nursing in pandemic 'like working in a war'
description: Nurses in one of England's worst-hit areas relive the year-long ordeal of caring for Covid patients.

title: England v San Marino: How do you improve world's worst national team?
description: They are bottom of the Fifa rankings, but San Marino drew their last two Nations League games. This is how the world's worst national team are getting (a bit) better.

title: 'Jules has Skype calls with Chris Gayle' - Married At First Sight's Cam Merchant on his life in cricket
description: Married At First Sight star Cam Merchant on his former life as a professional cricketer, visiting Sachin Tendulkar's house and Christmas with Chris Gayle.

title: The Papers: 'No jab no pint' and EU vaccine 'peace deal' with UK
description: Thursday's papers look at the prospect of pub goers needing proof of a Covid vaccination to gain entry.

title: Covid: The London bus trip that saved maybe a million lives
description: A conversation on a bus led to the setting up of the Recovery trial, leading to treatments for Covid.

title: KSI: 'I was struggling to sell tickets to gigs in 2019'
description: Newsbeat speaks to one of YouTube's biggest stars about what's next after selling out his 2021 tour.

title: Nagorno-Karabakh: The mystery of the missing church
description: The BBC investigates the disappearance of an Armenian church that changed hands in the recent Nagorno-Karabakh war.

title: Why cutting down trees can be good for the climate
description: Tree felling is helping to restore an ancient ecosystem which can store even more carbon than trees do.

title: 'I have learned how to survive with a bow and arrow'
description: The Covid pandemic and last summer's social unrest has inspired more Americans to take up hunting.

title: Coronavirus: Locked down with Mum and Dad
description: Many young people returned to live with their parents during the pandenic. How's it going, a year on?

title: Tate McRae's journey from ballet school to pop stardom
description: You Broke Me First was one of 2020's biggest break-out hits, but Tate McRae never intended to be a pop star.

title: 'I can't see myself going back to a five-day week'
description: We've all got used to working flexibly so employers will need to adapt, say campaigners.

title: 'My father, the killer'
description: Some of the children of men who helped to "disappear" thousands of Argentines in the 1970s and 80s are now speaking out - against their fathers.

title: Covid vaccine: Side effects and why it can’t give you the virus
description: It's normal to experience some mild side effects, such as a headache or a raised temperature.
